Latest data revelas the size of the Oscar's gender gap

A data-driven analysis of gender representation among nominees and winners throughout the 88 years of Academy Awards.

Data-driven analysis on the lack of female Nobel prize winners

Data-driven project looking at women Nobels. Did you know that less than 6% of the 874 (human) laureates are women?

Through the gender lens: one century of cinema history

Data analysis of 6,000 movies and their Bechdel Test scores. From Pauvre Pierrot (1892) to Jurassic World (2015).

Playboy, then and now

Data visualizations on half a century of Playmates.

The refugee crisis in data

Insights on the 2015 UNHCR Report through a series of interactive data visualizations that highlight specific angles of the global refugee crisis of the last years.

Semantic tool to access WikiLeaks' Spy Files

Project appeared on multiple news outlets, like The International Business Times, Schneier on Security, Netzpolitik, and Disinformation.

The Transparency Reports' Database

Aggregated, normalized, visualizable semantic DB of Transparency Reports from tech companies.

Privacy: quando il Web fa lo spione

Part of a series of analysis aggregating transparency reports from multiple tech companies. (In Italian)

Most Wanted”: Interpol’s transparency

Who’s on Interpol’s “Most Wanted” list? With the aid of scraping, data analysis and interactive visualization, this investigative reports reveals the worrying patterns behind Red Notice requests.

Social meets civic. Civic social media and open government data

An inquiry on collaborative fact-checking for citizens’ empowerment. MA research thesis.

The Donors Behind Italian Political Parties

Who funded Italian political parties between November 2012 and April 2013?

Monithon

Platform for citizen monitoring of Italian EU funded projects.

Blossoming Books

Are you a passionate reader? Ever thought of a network visualization to show off your bookshelf?

Watching the watchers

What surveillance research projects is the European Union funding? Is it striking any balance between privacy research and surveillance research?

Why Oscar is a male: gender gap at the Academy Awards

A interactive journalism project that investigates women’s presence among the nominees and winners at the Academy Awards.

The 2011 war in Libya in Italian newspapers

When Italian media were faced the task to inform the public on the events of the war in Libya, how did they respond?
